content: Am able to observe what is happening at my home anytime

Ought to be able to do everything in just one app, instead of this one to monitor devices, plus a separate app for account actions, PLUS having to use the website for simple tasks like changing sensor batteries. Also, crappy equipment and cannot add self-purchased equipment for single app monitoring. Will NOT be renewing my contract with them. (And no ADT, I do not want to call you to discuss it...)

While this app is a lot better than ADT Control, it's still pretty bad. I only get 10 seconds recordings. In testing it I saw myself walking down the sidewalk. Recording stopped just as I got to the walkway to my house. The next clip showed me walking away from my front door. Did this 2x. During daylight hours recordings of cars parked in front of my house are overexposed. Also during daylight hours I can barely make out my mailbox. Night time is a nightmare! I can only see cars passing by.

What is the problem with the application? Good morning, Before calling Customer Service today, I opened the app and everything worked perfectly!! The "problem" is resolved!!! We have used ADT for nine years and we so appreciate your outstanding customer service. Updating this review, many thanks !

So I contacted Pulse. Come to find out my doorbell had stopped working for months now. looks like someone tampered with it. I was to my understanding that in the event this should happen the alarm would go off (it didn't). second I was told that the doorbell had a battery in it that needed to be charged we weren't told that when it was installed. Also, the agent said we needed to plug it in every 2-3 months. Had I know that I would have never swapped out a hardwired doorbell for a dumbbell!
This ADT Pulse is awesome and easy to use to keep my family safe.👍⛑️🚒🚑🚓

UPDATE: I installed ADT's SoSecure app as they suggested...but I don't like it. It's too cumbersome and doesn't do what I want. A true panic button needs to be integrated into the Pulse app, with a widget that can be put on a home screen or dock for quick access. Everything ADT needs to know in order to send help to my house is already in my account. I don't want or need 'guardians' to be contacted! I just want a button that, when pushed, tells ADT to send the police, no ifs, ands, or buts about it, just *do* it. I paid several thousand dollars for my ADT Gold system, and it's appalling that something as obvious as a panic button isn't included with it. Finally, I don't like needing multiple apps, all for ADT. As it is, there's Pulse, MyADT, and now SoSecure. Wrap all their functionality into ONE app--and give it a true panic button! --------------------------- This app is okay, except for one glaring omission: a panic button. Say you're in your house, daytime, alarm not set, and armed burglars break in. Wouldn't you want a panic button on your phone to instantly notify ADT and the police? I do.

It's a decent app that allows you to remotely monitor your system, and to use the home automation functions from your phone. 3 problems, though. 1) You can't change security scripts (like when things turn on and off); 2) Doesn't allow both Landscape and Portrait displays, and 3) it takes a while to load...sometimes almost long enough to allow the alarm to sound when you're trying to deactivate it. Pretty minor quibbles, all things considered.

I can't leave home without this app. Thank you ADT for putting "Home Sweet Home" back into my house once again.

This is really helpful. It'll tell you everything you need to know to make sure everything is ready to set the alarm. If smoke alarm goes off, or for any reason, ADT dispatch will call you within 10 seconds. I became a slave to the main station box. I had to disalarm then reset it to clear before setting the alarm again. It can kinda be nerve racking with the alarms, telephone and sirens all blowing off at the same time. However, until it happens, you don't have to worry. Gave me peace of mind.
